problems.title: House Robber
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are a robber planning to rob houses along a street.
Each house has a certain amount of money.
Adjacent houses have security systems connected - if two adjacent houses are robbed, police will be alerted.

Given an array of N integers representing the amount of money in each house, find the maximum amount you can rob without alerting police.

DP Insight: For each house, decide to rob it or skip it.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
1 2 3 1

Sample Output
4

Explanation:
Rob house 1 (money = 1) and house 3 (money = 3).
Total = 1 + 3 = 4
Note: Houses 2 and 4 are adjacent to robbed houses.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    nums = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.rob(nums))

hintsList: At house i, you have two choices: skip it (keep dp[i-1]) or rob it (dp[i-2] + nums[i]).
dp[i] = max(dp[i-1], dp[i-2] + nums[i]). Handle base cases dp[0]=nums[0], dp[1]=max(nums[0],nums[1]).
